captions.text: OK.

Today, we're going
to demo a messy bun.

There are two ways
to do messy buns,

and I have uploaded the
other video already.
So this is messy bun number two.

I've already pulled
her hair just back

into just a regular
old pony tail.

There's no tricks
to it-- just a pony.

Now I'm going to start
by asking her-- will you
tip your head down, please?

So if she tips her
head forward, just

take her hair-- tip down a
little more-- far, far, far.

Thank you-- and just
let the hair fall

so that it just covers
entirely the rubber band.
Let's show daddy so he can see.

And then take
another rubber band

and just wrap it
around that hair.

So you're going to have just
a rubber band around hair.
I'll pull it out a little.
OK.
Head up.
Thanks.

So you can see I
just have hair--

a little bit of pony
sticking out on top.

Then I just take
sections of hair.

And you're just going to reach
in and grab the rubber band

and twist this hair back
under the rubber band.

You can go once or,
if you want, you

can wrap it around
a second time.

And then just let
the ends stick out.
And then get another section.

Remember, the idea
of these messy buns

is for them to be messy, so you
don't want to do it too nice.

This is a really long
piece, so I'll for sure
wrap this one twice.
Stick it under.

And then just
stick it back under
and let those ends hang out.
Come over to the side.
Stick it under.

And the smaller length
hair sections, you're

probably just going
to want to wrap once.
Reach in there.

This is the only hard part
is finding that rubber

band after you've rapped
your hair a couple times.
Pull it through.

And then if you
have-- this one's

coming out a
little-- re-tuck it.
OK.

So then you're going to just
have your ends sticking out.
Take your comb.

You can kind of separate
your ends a little bit.

Or if that's too
long for your taste,

just to find the rubber
band again and re-wrap

until it sticks out
the way you like it.
And just pull those ends around.
And there you have it.

Just a little bit of hairspray
for the front, especially.

And you have a really
cute messy bun.

And I did that on
dry hair today.

For this one, I like dry hair
because the ends separate

a little better and just
froof out a little more messy.

comments.text:
Wow autocorrect made that impossible to understand. Sorry! Let me try that 
again. So, instead of tucking only in the hairtie. Try tucking the ends in 
by grabbing a little loop piece from the main bug and tuck the ends in 
that. A combo of this and tucking in the hair tie gives an even messier 
look.

Something else i do is instead of tucking the ends around the hairtie also

and loop the ends in that i usualy tuck on opposite side of bun then end is 
to give messier effect.
